On August 11, the Pearland ISD Board of Trustees adopted the lowest district tax rate in three decades, triggering a Voter-Approved Tax Rate Election (VATRE). If approved, the VATRE will generate additional funds from the state while also lowering the 2020-21 property tax rate by nearly 4 cents to reduce the burden on local homeowners.

Passage will provide the necessary funds for Pearland ISD to sustain the district’s 1:1 device initiative, enhance educational opportunities for all students, continue recruiting, supporting and retaining world-class employees, as well as help the district move toward advancing its strategic goals.

The VATRE will be included on the upcoming November ballot. Election day is Nov. 3, with early voting from Oct. 13-30. To read the complete press release, visit: https://bit.ly/30Uf6xG

Dear Parents and the Class of 2020:

It has always been our desire to have an in-person graduation to honor our students this year.

With the recent guidance from the Texas Education Agency and Governor Abbott, Pearland ISD will be able to hold an outdoor graduation ceremony at Pearland ISD Stadium (3775 S. Main St., Pearland, TX).

Graduation ceremonies for high schools will be held as follows:
• Turner College & Career High School: Tuesday, June 2, 7:30 p.m.
• Dawson High School: Wednesday, June 3, 7:30 p.m.
• Pearland High School: Thursday, June 4, 7:30 p.m.

There will be a limit of two parents/guests per graduate. More details about the ceremonies and the guidelines we must follow to ensure everyone’s safety and follow social distancing measures will be shared in the coming days.

We look forward to honoring and celebrating our seniors and providing them with the best send-off allowable under our current circumstances.
